result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul O Brockert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul O Brockert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul O Brockert was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Adjudication w/h on ct 1. State agrees to dismiss ct 1 if def completes probation on ct 2 & doesn't commit any new crimes rising to the level of probable cause.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $343 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LB,CLB & CEB without written permission of PO agent. Def not to reside anywhere that firearms are kept.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
